title._content: Brigadier General Clarence S. ""Bill"" Irvine Special Collection Photo

description._content: Catalog #: 09_01907 Title: Brigadier General Clarence S. ""Bill"" Irvine Special Collection Photo Additional Information: Group shot of men and women in formal wear attending a dinner dance. Handwritten inscription ""When I arrived here - the Air Corps Officers and ladies gave a dinner dance at the ?? and ?? Club to the newcomers. It was quite a gay affair - quite a little real ?? and old scotch. 1. See your wandering son in his new white uniform in foreground. 2. A very good friend of mine talk of table. Lt. Brown. 3. The wife - little but sweet"", Brigadier General Clarence Irvine enjoyed a long distinguished military career, mainly involving engineering. He served with the XXI Bomber Command (B-29's) during WWII and continued to serve throughout the 1950s and 1960s. Tags: Brigadier General Clarence S. ""Bill"" Irvine Special Collection Photo Repository: San Diego Air and Space Museum Archive
